intro: Phyllanthus varians, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a rough texture, while its flowers are inconspicuous and grouped in cyathia. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
